text: I'm working on some Pluto notebooks to serve as tutorials for students (of all ages!) to learn about some of the data products our team produces and some related domain specific concepts.  Is there a way to host notebooks such that users can access them, interact with the UI elements (sliders, select boxes, etc), see plots and other outputs update dynamically in response to their UI choices, and even look at the contents of the cells to see how they work, but NOT let them edit the contents of the cells (or only edit some cells)?  Is this type of thing being done in classroom settings already?

elements.text: I'm working on some Pluto notebooks to serve as tutorials for students (of all ages!) to learn about some of the data products our team produces and some related domain specific concepts. Is this type of thing being done in classroom settings already?

text:
Have you seen the notebooks for the MIT intro to computational thinking class?
<https://computationalthinking.mit.edu/Spring21/transforming_images/>

elements.text: Have you seen the notebooks for the MIT intro to computational thinking class?

text: That's exactly the kind of thing I'd like to setup!  Where can I find instructions to replicate that setup with my own notebooks?
